sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A true, sincere and modest defence, of English Catholiques that suffer for their faith both at home and abrode against a false, seditious and slanderous libel intituled; The exectuion of iustice in England. VVherein is declared, hovv vniustlie the Protestants doe charge Catholiques vvith treason ... Allen, William, 1532-1594.
[8], 219, [5] p.
Fr. Parsons' press, [Rouen : 1584]
By William Allen. A reply to: Cecil, William. The execution of justice in England for maintenaunce of publique and Christian peace. Imprint information from STC. With a final errata leaf. The last leaf is blank. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
A true, sincere and modest defence, of English Catholiques that suffer for their faith both at home and abrode against a false, seditious and slanderous libel intituled; The exectuion of iustice in England. VVherein is declared, hovv vniustlie the Protestants doe charge Catholiques vvith treason ... Allen, William, 1532-1594.
[8], 219, [5] p.
Fr. Parsons' press, [Rouen : 1584]
By William Allen. A reply to: Cecil, William. The execution of justice in England for maintenaunce of publique and Christian peace. Imprint information from STC. With a final errata leaf. The last leaf is blank. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
>>>>>>> imprintparse
